name: Nano Technologies
headline: Payroll app to pay workers daily for retailers & manufacturers in SEA
description:
Nano is an income streaming app which pays workers daily instead of monthly for retailers and manufacturers in South East Asia. 

This is essential because these employers compete for workers with the gig economy, which pays daily with a flexible work schedule. 

Nano integrates seamlessly with any HRM/Attendance Software from employers, helping them save turnover costs and build a more engaged and productive workforce.

founders.name: Dzung Dang, Founder
founders.description: Dzung (CEO) was formerly GM for Uber in Vietnam with 5 million users before Uber sold to Grab valuing the Vietnam business $300mn+; ZaloPay CEO - mobile wallet); Previously management consultant at McKinsey in Southeast Asia focused on banking.

founders.name: Thang Nguyen, Founder
founders.description: Software engineer & leader which luckily have opportunity to build many exciting products varies from e-commerce & crowd funding, consumer hardware products, enterprise blockchain ... Love to solve challenging problems and create value for society.

generated_description:
**Nano Technologies: Revolutionizing Payroll in Southeast Asia**

Founded in 2020 and part of the Y Combinator W21 batch, Nano Technologies is reshaping how workers get paid in Southeast Asia, specifically targeting the retail and manufacturing sectors. The core of their mission is the **Vui** payroll app, an innovative solution that allows employers to pay their employees daily instead of the traditional monthly cycle. 

This approach isn't just a nice-to-have; it’s a necessity in today’s gig economy, where flexible payment schedules are the norm. With Vui, businesses can maintain a competitive edge by attracting and retaining talent that might otherwise jump into more flexible gigs.

The app seamlessly integrates with existing HRM and attendance software, minimizing turnover costs and cultivating a more engaged workforce. This offers employers not only cost savings but also boosts productivity—who wouldn’t want that?

Headquartered in Vietnam, the company currently operates with a team of 17 employees under the mentorship of Group Partner Michael Seibel. They’re essentially positioned at the intersection of fintech and SaaS—offering a tech solution that provides fluid financial management for both employees and employers alike. 

So why does it matter? Well, beyond just ensuring workers are paid on time, it addresses broader financial stress that many workers face, especially in times of economic hardship. Fast access to wages can be a game changer, allowing individuals to manage their finances better, reduce debt, and improve their overall quality of life.

As more businesses adopt daily payment systems, Nano Technologies is at the forefront of a significant shift in the employment landscape in Southeast Asia. They’re not just transforming payroll; they're pioneering a movement towards more humane labor practices in the region. 

For more information on how Vui can help your business, check out their website at [VuiApp.vn](http://www.vuiapp.vn).
